thread.title: Police arrest student who brought loaded gun to Boston high school - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Police arrest student who brought loaded gun to Boston high school - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Police arrest student who brought loaded gun to Boston high school - Massachusetts news
text:
Police have arrested a 15-year-old high school student from Dorchester who allegedly brought a loaded gun to school on Thursday.
The juvenile, who police have not named, was arrested and charged with delinquent to wit, unlawful possession of a firearm, unlawful possession of ammunition, and resisting arrest, according to police .
Around 10:40 a.m. Thursday, the Boston Public School Safety Service responded to a report that a student had a firearm at TechBoston Academy in Mattapan. The student had reportedly arrived to school late and had tried to avoid the metal detectors at the building’s entrance. As a result, he was subjected to an administrative search. Upon opening the student’s backpack, officers saw a gun, police said. The student then fled from the office.
 After a struggle, officers were able to apprehend the student and recover the loaded .32 caliber handgun from the backpack, according to police.
“There is never a good reason to bring a gun to school. Illegal guns have no place on our streets and certainly not in the hands of a child,” Boston Police Commissioner William Evans said in a release. “Thanks to the keen observations and quick actions of the school police officers and administrators, a potential tragedy was avoided and one less gun is on the streets.”
